thread.title: Red Devils edge out Wesleyan soccer teams
thread.title_full: Red Devils edge out Wesleyan soccer teams

author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Red Devils edge out Wesleyan soccer teams
text:
Red Devils edge out Wesleyan soccer teams Oct 15, 2015 
The Iowa Wesleyan soccer teams traveled to Eureka College for SLIAC competition on Tuesday. The men’s game kicked off at 1 p.m. and the women followed at 3 p.m. Both games were close, but the Iowa Wesleyan men’s team fell 3-1 and the women’s team suffered a 2-1 loss to the Red Devils. 
In the men’s game, three first half goals proved to be too much for the Tigers to overcome. Eureka took fifteen shots in the first period and Josh Bonilla recorded six saves in the opening period. Iowa Wesleyan did not give themselves many opportunities to score in the first half. The Tigers had just two shots in the opening period. 
In the second half, Iowa Wesleyan stepped up their offensive attack and were able to get off five shots. Josue Nicolas scored the lone goal for the Tigers at the 63:59 minute mark. The Tigers had three opportunities for goals late in the second half but they could not get the ball past Eureka’s goalie. 
Iowa Wesleyan ended the day with seven shots and six shots on goal. Isaiah Lucatero-Flores and Josue Nicolas each led the Tigers with two shots on goal. Josh Bonilla finished the game with eight saves. 
The Iowa Wesleyan women’s team came into the game this afternoon looking for a win against the Red Devils. In the first meeting between the two teams this season, the game ended in a 0-0 tie. Iowa Wesleyan fought hard in another low scoring game, but the Red Devils came out with a 2-1 win. 
Iowa Wesleyan fell behind 0-1 with 35:31 remaining in the first period. Ashley Newell scored the game tying goal with 41:50 on the clock. Both teams would fail to score the remainder of the opening period. Caitlin O’Neill recorded on save in the first period. 
The second half saw Eureka step up their attack with 12 shots in the final period. Iowa Wesleyan had just two shots in the second half. The Red Devils scored the go ahead goal at the 75:10 minute mark. The Tigers could not find the net in the second period and fell to Eureka 2-1. Caitlin O’Neill ended the day with six saves. Iowa Wesleyan finished the game with seven shots and three shots on goal. Celina Paz and Kassie Vazquez led the team with two shots each. 
Iowa Wesleyan will return to action this Saturday. The Tigers will travel to Elsah, Ill. to take on Principia College. The men’s game is set for 1 p.m and the women’s game is set to follow at 3 p.m.
